newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: Bahrain's index ends slow week 2.06 points up.
newsitem.headline: Bahrain's index ends slow week 2.06 points up.

text.p: Bahrain's share index ended the week 2.06 points higher in lacklustre trade dominated by bank shares, official figures showed on Thursday.
The Bahrain Stock Exchange said the index rose to 1,333.29 points in the week ending on Thursday from 1,331.23 points a week earlier.
It said trading volume fell sharply to 2.5 million shares worth 360,092 dinars ($955,152) from 4.8 million shares worth 728,327 dinars the previous week.
The bourse said shares of Bahrain Middle East Bank dominated trade, with 1.57 million shares worth 106,023 dinars changing hands. The bank closed half a fil higher at 67.5 fils.
The exchange said 128,059 Investcorp shares worth 66,140 dinars were traded. Its share price was flat at $1.37.
Shares of 16 firms out of the 39 registered at the bourse were traded in 58 transactions, it added.
Bahrain's bourse is open to nationals in Gulf Arab states -- Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Qatar, Oman, Bahrain and the United Arab Emirates. Some firms are also open to foreign investors.
